marketNews.title: Indonesia Economy Grows +5.03% YoY in 2024
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Central Bureau of Statistics (BPS) reported that Indonesia's economic growth reached +5.02% year‑on‑year (YoY) in the fourth quarter of 2024, surpassing the consensus estimate of +4.98% YoY. Quarterly, the economy grew +0.53% quarter‑on‑quarter (QoQ) in 4Q24, slightly below the consensus of +0.56% QoQ. Overall, Indonesia's 2024 growth was +5.03% YoY, lower than the government target of +5.2% YoY and marking the slowest growth in three years, though still within Bank Indonesia's target range of +4.7‑5.5% YoY. Domestic consumption (+4.94% YoY) and gross fixed capital formation (+4.61% YoY) were the largest contributors, adding +2.6 percentage points and +1.43 percentage points respectively. Net exports contributed -0.01 percentage points due to import growth of +7.95% YoY versus export growth of +6.51% YoY. Government consumption added +0.48 percentage points. Regionally, growth was weakest in Java (+4.92% YoY) and Sumatra (+4.45% YoY) compared with stronger performance in Maluku and Papua (+7.81% YoY), Sulawesi (+6.18% YoY), Bali and Nusa Tenggara (+5.04% YoY), and Kalimantan (+5.52% YoY).

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The government and Bank Indonesia each target Indonesia's economic growth in 2025 at +5.2% and +4.7‑5.5% respectively. Considering external uncertainties such as trade wars and potential Fed rate cuts, the achievement of the growth target will depend more on the government's success in boosting domestic consumption. The focus on domestic consumption could positively affect consumer stocks such as ICBP, MYOR, AMRT, and TSPC.

marketNews.title: Philippines May Ratify Bill Banning Raw Mineral Exports
marketNews.content: Philippine Senate President Francis Escudero said the Philippine Congress could ratify a bill that bans the export of raw minerals, including nickel ore, as early as June 2025. The bill aims to boost downstream mining by prohibiting raw ore exports, with the ban taking effect five years after the law is signed. The Philippines is the world's second‑largest nickel ore exporter, mainly to China. Industry groups warn the ban could lead to mine closures and major supply‑chain disruptions.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Targets 220 Million Tons of Nickel Production in 2025
marketNews.content: Director General of Minerals and Coal, Tri Winarno, said the government targets nickel production of about 220 million tons in 2025, close to the 2024 work plan target of 240 million tons. No definitive steps have been taken to cut the 2025 target, and the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources is still evaluating the plan.

marketNews.title: C4ADS Reports 75% of Indonesia Nickel Smelter Capacity Controlled by Chinese Firms
marketNews.content: Global security nonprofit C4ADS reported that about 75% of Indonesia's nickel smelter capacity in 2023 is controlled by Chinese companies. Two Chinese firms, Tsingshan Holding Group and Jiangsu Delong Nickel Industry Co. Ltd., together own more than 70% of the capacity. The report highlights that Chinese dominance may limit Indonesia's ability to shape its own downstream nickel industry and could disadvantage U.S. and European automakers in the global electric‑vehicle market.

marketNews.title: Indonesia's IKN Project Stalled Due to Budget Block
marketNews.content: Minister of Public Works Dody Hanggodo said the development of the new capital city (IKN) has no progress because the budget is blocked by Finance Minister Sri Mulyani. The block is related to a budget efficiency policy, with the House Commission V approving a cut to the Public Works Ministry's 2025 budget from 81.38 trillion rupiah to 29.57 trillion rupiah. Several infrastructure projects are affected, and the minister will report the adjustments to the finance minister and recalculate the ministry's budget composition.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Health Insurance Premium Increase Under Discussion
marketNews.content: Health Minister Budi Gunadi Sadikin said the ministry, together with the Finance Ministry and BPJS Health, is calculating an increase in BPJS Health premiums, planned to take effect in 2026. The increase is not linked to the upcoming Standard Inpatient Class (KRIS) to be implemented by June 30, 2025, but to potential higher claims for heart disease, stroke, and other illnesses. Earlier, BPJS Health Planning Director Mahlil Ruby warned that intensified programs could cause payment defaults by June 2026.

marketNews.title: Foreign Investors Net Sell $229 Million in Indonesia in Jan 2025
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that foreign investors sold a net $12.5 billion across Asian equity markets in January 2025, including a net sell of $229 million from the Indonesian stock market. The outflow was driven by higher U.S. Treasury yields and concerns over Asian export prospects amid additional U.S. tariffs on China.

marketNews.title: US Services PMI Falls to 52.8 in Jan 2025
marketNews.content: The Institute for Supply Management recorded that the U.S. services Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) fell to 52.8 in January 2025, down from 54 in December 2024 and below the forecast of 54.3. ISM Chairman Steve Miller noted that respondents cited bad weather and concerns about potential U.S. tariff actions as factors affecting business conditions.

marketNews.title: Bloomberg Reports eFishery Under Investigation, Investors Advised to Decide
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that FTI Consulting Singapore, hired by eFishery investors to investigate alleged financial statement fraud, recommended that investors decide quickly between liquidating or restructuring the start‑up. Meanwhile, the eFishery workers' union is urging the company to cancel planned mass layoffs and continue operations.

tickerNews.content: The government and Bank Indonesia each target Indonesia's economic growth in 2025 at +5.2% and +4.7‑5.5% respectively. tickerNews.title: DEWA Amends Private Placement Share Price to Rp75 per Share
tickerNews.content: DEWA announced that it has signed an amendment to the debt settlement agreement through a private placement with PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara and PT Andhesti Tungkas Pratama, raising the new share price from Rp65 to Rp75 per share. The amendment concerns a private placement of approximately 17.2 billion new shares to convert debt of about Rp1.1 trillion, to be taken up by the two companies. DEWA also mentioned ongoing discussions with another creditor to participate in the private placement, without further details.

tickerNews.title: BBCA EVP Assures Customer Data Safety Amid Ransomware Rumors
tickerNews.content: The EVP of Corporate Communication & Social Responsibility at Bank Central Asia, Hera F. Haryn, told Katadata on Thursday (6/2) that the bank ensures customer data remains safe, refuting social media claims that a ransomware group was targeting 4.9 million BCA Mobile customer records. She stated the rumors were false.

tickerNews.title: BRMS Targets Gold Production Over 75,000 Ounces in 2025
tickerNews.content: The Director of Bumi Resources Minerals, Herwin Wahyu Hidayat, said the company aims to produce more than 75,000 troy ounces of gold in 2025, a 36.4% YoY increase from the 2024 projection of 55,000 ounces (vs. the 2024 target of 35,000 ounces). Production will continue to be supported by Block 1 Poboya in Palu, Central Sulawesi, with further exploration of adjacent blocks. Production is expected to surge after an underground mining project in Palu becomes operational in the second half of 2027. BRMS is finalizing a loan of about USD 200‑300 million for the project, to be announced in 1Q25.

tickerNews.title: Petrosea Commissioner Erwin Ciputra Buys 500,000 PTRO Shares
tickerNews.content: Petrosea Commissioner Erwin Ciputra purchased 500,000 PTRO shares at an average price of Rp3,712 per share on 3 February 2025, totaling approximately Rp1.86 billion. After the transaction, Ciputra's ownership in PTRO increased from 0.0679% to 0.0729%.

tickerNews.title: BRIS Reports 2024 Net Profit of 7 Trillion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Bank Syariah Indonesia recorded a net profit of Rp1.9 trillion in 4Q24 (+26% YoY, +11% QoQ), bringing the 2024 net profit to Rp7 trillion (+23% YoY), equal to 103% of the FY24F consensus estimate. Revenue after profit-sharing distribution grew to Rp5.1 trillion (+19% YoY, +9.6% QoQ) in 4Q24, reaching Rp18.6 trillion (+8.3% YoY) for the full year. Non‑operational income rose +34% YoY in 2024, while operating expenses increased +15% YoY. Provisions fell -25% YoY as cost of credit dropped to 0.83%, the lowest post‑merger level. Non‑Performing Financing fell to 1.9% in 2024 (vs. 2.1% in 2023). Financing grew +15.9% YoY in 2024 (vs. +15.7% YoY in 2023), with a 2025 financing growth target of +14‑16% YoY.

tickerNews.title: ELSA Aims for 5% Revenue Growth and 15% Profit Growth in 2025
tickerNews.content: The Manager of Corporate Communications at Elnusa, Jayanty Oktavia Maulina, said the company targets about a 5% YoY revenue increase in 2025, with a net profit growth target of around 15% YoY. ELSA expects the oil and gas (migas) industry outlook to improve in 2025 due to new investments and government programs aiming for energy self‑sufficiency. The company will continue diversifying its portfolio into non‑migas segments, focusing on upstream services such as seismic surveys for coal mining. Capital expenditure for 2025 will be about 10% higher YoY (vs. 2024 capex of Rp526 billion), with 44% allocated to upstream operations, 37% to energy distribution and logistics, and the remainder to new businesses, upstream support, and non‑production projects.

tickerNews.title: BSDE Marketing Sales 2024 Reaches 9.72 Trillion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: Bumi Serpong Damai recorded marketing sales of Rp2.88 trillion in 4Q24 (+44% QoQ, +5% YoY). The full‑year marketing sales reached Rp9.72 trillion (+2.3% YoY), slightly above the 2024 target of Rp9.5 trillion (102% of target). The residential segment contributed 55.5% of total marketing sales, followed by retail (23.8%), commercial lots (8.2%), apartments (6.7%), and land sales to joint ventures (5.8%).

tickerNews.title: AKRA Share Purchases by PT Arthakencana Rayatama and Director Nery Polim
tickerNews.content: PT Arthakencana Rayatama, the controlling shareholder of AKR Corporindo, bought approximately 10.2 million AKRA shares at an average price of Rp1,107 per share between 30 January and 4 February 2025, costing about Rp11.3 billion. After the transaction, its ownership increased from 63.64% to 63.69%. In a separate transaction, AKRA Director Nery Polim bought 85,000 AKRA shares at an average price of Rp1,120 per share on 31 January 2025, costing about Rp95.2 million, raising his ownership from 0.0084% to 0.0088%.

tickerNews.title: LPKR Marketing Sales 2024 6.01 Trillion Rupiah, Target 2025 6.25 Trillion
tickerNews.content: Lippo Karawaci reported marketing sales of Rp6.01 trillion in 2024 (+17% YoY), surpassing the 2024 target of approximately Rp5.4 trillion (112% of target). LPKR set a 2025 marketing sales target of Rp6.25 trillion, to be driven by new residential and commercial developments in Lippo Karawaci, Lippo Cikarang, and other landbank areas.

tickerNews.title: TOBA COO Pandu Sjahrir Appointed to Danantara
tickerNews.content: The Senate President of the Philippines, Francis Escudero, said that Toba's Vice President of Operations, Pandu Sjahrir, will become a senior executive at Danantara. In an Instagram post on Monday (3/2), Maruarar Sirait announced Pandu as 'bos Danantara'. Business reported that Pandu will serve as Chief Operating Officer at Danantara, though he has not commented on the appointment.
